intro: Stifftia cayennensis, commonly known as the Cayenne stifftia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Guyana. The plant is characterized by its palm-like appearance, with a single, unbranched stem and large, broad leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, clustered in inflorescences at the base of the leaves. Stifftia cayennensis is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking foliage and unique floral structure.
